isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - LIGHT SYSTEMS - OPERATION - Headlight System Without DRL, With Signal-Stat 910 Turn Signal Switch, Push Button Dimmer Switch, and Without International Engine

svcproc.title: Headlight System Without DRL, With Signal-Stat 910 Turn Signal Switch, Push Button Dimmer Switch, and Without International Engine
svcproc.para: Power is supplied to (J1) junction block, circuit 14F, fuse F26, and circuit 50 to the headlight switch (35). When the headlight switch (35) is moved to the headlight on position, power flows through circuit 51, connector (1), circuit 51F, connector (17), circuit 51B, dimmer relay (276) N.C. contacts, circuit 53D, connector (17), circuits 53B, 53, connector (2), and circuit 53 to a splice.

From the splice, power flows through circuit 53B to the left headlight (502) low beam element. The ground path is through circuits 11-GC, 11-GB, connector (2), and circuit 11-GB to cab ground. This causes the headlight dim element to illuminate.

From the splice, power also flows through circuit 53A to the right headlight (504) low beam element. The ground path is through circuits 11-GE, 11-GB, connector (2), and circuit 11-GB to cab ground. This causes the headlight dim element to illuminate.

Power is supplied to (J1) junction block circuit 14A, fuse F7, circuit 63, and 50E to the dimmer relay (276) coil. When the push button dimmer switch is pushed to select high beam headlight elements, a ground path is provided through circuit 51-GA, connector (421), a white wire, the push button dimmer switch, a white wire, connector (421), circuit 52-GA, and 11-G to cab ground. This energizes the dimmer relay (276).
With the relay energized, power flows through the N.O. contacts of dimmer relay (276), circuit 52D, connector (17), circuits 52F, 52, connector (2), and circuit 52 to a splice.

From the splice, power flows through circuit 52C to the left headlight (502) high beam element. The ground path is through circuits 11-GC, 11-GB, connector (2), and circuit 11-GB to cab ground. This causes the headlight bright element to illuminate.

From the splice, power also flows through circuit 52B to the right headlight (504) high beam element. The ground path is through circuits 11-GE, 11-GB, connector (2), and circuit 11-GB to cab ground. This causes the headlight bright element to illuminate.
